source: Sayyid Abul Ala Maududi - Tafhim al-Qur'an - The Meaning of the Quran
short_text: The Surah takes its name from the word al-muddaththir in the first verse. This also is only a name, not a title of its subject matter.
text: The Surah takes its name from the word al-muddaththir in the first verse. This also is only a name, not a title of its subject matter.
Period of Revelation

The first seven verses of this Surah belong to the earliest period at Makkah. Even according to some traditions which have been related in Bukhari, Muslim, Tirmidhi, Musnad Ahmad, etc., on the authority of Hadrat Jabir bin Abdullah, these are the very earliest verses of the Qur'an to be revealed to the Holy Prophet (upon whoa be peace). But the Muslim Ummah almost unanimously agreed that the earliest Revelation to the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) consisted of the first five verses of Surah Al-Alaq(XCVI). However, what is established by authentic traditions is that after this first Revelation, no Revelation came down to the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) for quite some time. Then, when it was resumed, it started with theme verses of Surah Al- Muddaththir. Imam Zuhri has given the following details of it:

"Revelation to the Holy Prophet remained suspended for quite some time, and it was such a period of deep grief and distress for him that he started going early to the tops of the mountains to throw himself down from them. But whenever he stood on the edge of a peak, the Angel Gabriel would appear and tell him that he was Allah's Prophet. This would console him and restore to him full peace of mind." (Ibn Jarir).
After this Imam Zuhri relates the following tradition on the authority of Hadrat Jabir bin Abdullah:

"The Holy Messenger of Allah describing the period of falrat al-wahi (break in revelation) said: One day when I was passing on the way, I suddenly heard a call from heaven. I raised my head and saw that the same Angel who had visited me in the Cave of Hira was sitting on a throne between heaven and earth. This struck terror in my heart, and reaching home quickly, I said: 'Cover me up, cover me up'. So the people of the house covered me up with a quilt (or blanket). At that time Allah sent down the Revelation: Ya ayyuhal-Muddaththiru... From then on revelation became intense and continuous." (Bukhari, Muslim Musnad Ahmad, Ibn Jarir).

The rest of the Surah (vv. 8-56) was revealed when the first Hajj season came after public preaching of Islam had begun in Makkah. This has been fully well described in the Sirah by Ibn Hisham and we shall cite it below.
Theme and Subject Matter

As has been explained above, the earliest Revelation to the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) consisted of the first five verses of Surah Al-Alaq, in which it had been Said: "Read (O Prophet), in the name of your Lord, Who created: created man from a clot of congealed blood. Read: and your Lord is Most Generous, Who taught knowledge by the pen, taught man what he did not know."

This was the first experience of Revelation met with suddenly by the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace). in this message it was not told what great mission he had been entrusted with and what duties he had to perk form in future. He was only initiated into it and then left alone for a time so that the great strain this experience had caused should pass away and he should mentally become prepared to receive the Revelation and perform the prophetic mission in the future. After this intermission when Revelation Was resumed, the first seven verses of this Surah Were revealed:In these he Was for the first time commanded to arise and warn the people of the consequences of the way of life they were following and to proclaim the greatness of God in the world where others were being magnified without any right. Along with that he was given this instruction: The demand of the Unique mission that you have to perform, now is that your life should be pure in every respect and you should carry out the duty of reforming your people sincerely irrespective of any worldly gain. Then, in the last sentence, he was exhorted to endure with patience, for the sake of his Lord, all the hardships and troubles that he might have to face while performing his mission.

In the implementation of this Divine Command when the Holy Messenger of Allah began to preach Islam and recite the Qur'anic Surahs revealed successively, the people of Makkah felt alarmed, and it provoked a great storm of opposition and hostility. A few months passed in this state until the Hajj season approached. The people of Makkah feared that if Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace) started visiting the caravans of the pilgrims coming from all over Arabia at their halting places and reciting the spell binding and unique Revelations of the Qur'an in their assemblies on the occasion of Hajj, his message would reach every part of Arabia and influence countless people. Therefore, the Quraish chiefs held a conference and settled that they would start a propaganda campaign against the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) among the pilgrims as soon as they arrived.

After they had agreed on this, Walid bin al-Mughirah said to the assembled people: "If you said contradictory things about Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings), we all would lose our trust among the people. Therefore, let us agree upon one opinion, which we should all say without dispute.

Some people said that they would call Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings) a soothsayer. Walid said: “No, by God, be is not a soothsayer. We have seen the soothsayers: what they murmur and what they utter has no remote resemblance with the Qur'an.”

Some other people said: “Then we say he is possessed.” Walid said: He is not a possessed one: we have seen mad and insane people; the way one talks disjointedly and behaves foolishly in that state is known to all: who would believe that what Muhammad (upon whom be peace) presented was the incoherent speech of a madman?”
The people said: “Then we say he is a poet.” Walid said: “No, he is not a poet, for we know poetry in all its forms, and what he presents conforms to no form of it.”

The people said: “Then he is a sorcerer.” Walid said: “He is no sorcerer either: we have seen sorcerers and we also know what methods they adopt for their sorcery. This also does not apply to Muhammad.”

Then he said: "Whichever of these things you said about Muhammad, it would be known to be a false accusation. By God, his speech is sweet, his root is deep and his branches are fruitful.” At this Abu Jahl urging on Walid said: “Your people will never be pleased with you unless you say something about Muhammad.” He said: “Let me think over it awhile.”

Then, after prolonged thought and consideration, he said: “The nearest thing to the truth is that you tell the Arabs that he is a sorcerer, who has brought a message by which he separates a man from his father; and from his brother, and from his wife and children, and from his family.” They all agreed on what Walid had proposed.

Then, according to a scheme the men of Quraish spread among the pilgrims in the Hajj season and they warned everyone they met of the sorcery of Muhammad (upon whom be peace) and of his stirring up divisions in the families by it." But the result was that by their this plan the Quraish chiefs themselves made the name of the Holy Messenger known throughout Arabia. (Ibn Hisham, pp. 288-289. That Walid had made this proposal on the insistence of Abu Jahl has been related by Ibn Jarir in his Tafsir on the authority of Ikrimah).
This same event has been reviewed and commented upon in the second section of this Surah. The sequence of its contents is as follows:
In vv. 8-10 the deniers of Truth have been warned, saying: "You will see the evil result of what you are doing today on the Resurrection Day."

In vv. 11-26, without naming Walid bin al-Mughirah, it has been told how Allah had blessed him and how inimical he proved to be to true Faith. In this connection, his mental conflict has been portrayed, telling that, on the one hand, he was fully convinced of the truth of Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings) and the Qur'an, but, on the other, he did not want to risk his leadership and position among his people. Therefore, not only he did not believe himself but after a long-drawn-out conflict with his conscience he also came out with the proposal that in order to restrain the people from believing the Qur'an should be branded as magic. After exposing his evil nature, it has been said: "Notwithstanding such evil inclinations and misdeeds, this person desires that he should be further blessed, whereas he has now become worthy of Hell, and never of further blessings."
In vv. 27-48, the dreadfulness of Hell has been depicted and it has been explained as to people of what character and morals really deserve it.

In vv. 49-53, the root cause of the disbelievers' aversion has been pointed out, saying: "Since they are fearless of the Hereafter, and look upon this worldly life as an end in itself, they flee from the Qur'an as though they were wild asses fleeing away from the lion: therefore, they propose unreasonable conditions for believing, whereas even if each and every condition of theirs was fulfilled, they could not advance even an inch on the way of Faith with their denial of the Hereafter."

In conclusion, it has been explicitly stated: Allah does not stand in need of anybody's faith that He may fulfill his conditions. The Qur'an is an admonition that has been presented before the people openly; now whoever wills may accept it. Allah has a right that the people should fear His disobedience and He alone has the power to forgive the one who adopts piety and an attitude of God consciousness even though one may have committed many acts of disobedience in the past.
description: The surah that opens by addressing the enwrapped Prophet as the Shrouded Messenger. It takes its name from the word “wrapped in mantle” (muddaththir) in verse 1. The first verses of this surah (verse 1 .) were revealed after one of the Prophets first encounter with the Angel of Revelation in the Cave of Ḥirāʾ. The surah goes on, in a section from a later period, to remind the obstinate disbelievers of their fate on the Day of Judgement (verse 8 .) and a specific opponent of the Prophet is singled out (verse 11 .). The end of the surah (verse 39 .) exposes the foolishness of the disbelievers” attitude to the Revelation and the Day of Resurrection.The surah is also known as: The Cloaked One, The Enfolded, The Enfolded One, The Enveloped, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Mantled Messenger, Wrapped in his Cloak.

Efendi Nahi.verse 74:16: Jo, kurrsesi! Me të vërtetë, ai është mohues kryeneç i ajeteve Tona;
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:17: e Unë do ta ngarkojë atë me dënime të rënda,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:18: sepse, ka paramenduar dhe ka kurdisur (kundër Kur’anit), -
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:19: dhe, qoftë mallkuar, si e ka kurdisur!
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:20: dhe sërish – edhe njëherë, qoftë mallkuar, si e ka kurdisur! –
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:22: e, u vrejt dhe iu mrrol (fytyra)
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:23: dhe u kthye (nga mendimi i drejtë) dhe u kapardis,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:24: dhe tha: “Ky (Kur’ani) nuk është gjë tjetër, përpos magji trashëguese,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:27: e kush të shpjegon ty se çka është Sekari?
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:28: Ai nuk lë gjë dhe i përfshinë të gjithë (i djegë)
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:29: lëkurat iu bënë të zeza (nga të djegurit)
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:31: Na, kemi bërë rojtarë të zjarrit (engjëj) dhe kemi caktuar numrin e tyre, vetëm për t’i provuar jobesimtarët; për ‘tu bindur njerëzit, të cilëve, u është dhënë Libri, që t’u shtohet (forcohet) besimi atyre që besojnë, e mos të dyshojnë, ata, të cilëve u është dhënë Libri, - dhe për të thënë ata që janë zemërkëqinj (hipokrit) dhe jobesimtarë: “C’ka dashur Zoti (të tregojë) me këtë shembull?” Kështu, Perëndia i lë në hutim (dhe në humbje) ata që do, dhe në rrugë të drejtë e udhëzon atë që don.
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:35: ajo (skëterra), me të vërtetë, është njëra nga fatkeqësitë më të mëdha,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:37: për ata nga ju që dëshirojnë të bëjnë mirë ose të abstenojnë (në këtë)!
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:38: Cdo njeri është peng (përgjegjës) për veprat e veta,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:40: të cilët në kopshtijet e xhenneti i pyesin fajtorët:
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:42: “Cka u ka sjellë juve në Sekar (Skëterrë)?”
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:43: Ata do të përgjigjen: “Nuk kemi qenë nga ata që kanë bërë namaz
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:44: dhe prej atyre që i kanë ushqyer të varfërit
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:45: dhe jemi lëshuar në biseda të kota me djerraditësit (badihavxhinjtë),
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:46: dhe kemi përgënjeshtruar Ditën e Kijametit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:48: Kurrfarë ndërmjetësimi i ndërmjetësuesve nuk do t’u ndihmojë atyre.
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:49: E, përse shmangën ata nga këshillimi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:50: thua se janë gomarë të egër,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:51: të frikësuar, që kanë ikur prej luanit.
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:52: Po! Cdonjëri nga ata do të kërkojë që t’i jepet rregjistri i qartë (nga Zoti).
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:53: Kurrsesi, pasi që ata nuk i frikohen Ditës së Kijametit!
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:54: Ai (Kur’ani), në të vërtetë, është këshillë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:55: dhe kush të dojë, le ta pranojë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 74:56: e këshillohen vetëm ata që do Perëndia; Ai është i vetmi të cilit duhet t’i druajmë dhe Ai është i vetmi falës.

null.verse 74:18: সে চিন্তা করেছে এবং মনঃস্থির করেছে,
null.verse 74:19: ধ্বংস হোক সে, কিরূপে সে মনঃস্থির করেছে!
null.verse 74:20: আবার ধ্বংস হোক সে, কিরূপে সে মনঃস্থির করেছে!
null.verse 74:22: অতঃপর সে ভ্রূকুঞ্চিত করেছে ও মুখ বিকৃত করেছে,
null.verse 74:23: অতঃপর পৃষ্ঠপ্রদশন করেছে ও অহংকার করেছে।
null.verse 74:24: এরপর বলেছেঃ এতো লোক পরস্পরায় প্রাপ্ত জাদু বৈ নয়,
null.verse 74:25: এতো মানুষের উক্তি বৈ নয়।
null.verse 74:26: আমি তাকে দাখিল করব অগ্নিতে।
null.verse 74:27: আপনি কি বুঝলেন অগ্নি কি?
null.verse 74:28: এটা অক্ষত রাখবে না এবং ছাড়বেও না।
null.verse 74:31: আমি জাহান্নামের তত্ত্বাবধায়ক ফেরেশতাই রেখেছি। আমি কাফেরদেরকে পরীক্ষা করার জন্যেই তার এই সংখ্যা করেছি-যাতে কিতাবীরা দৃঢ়বিশ্বাসী হয়, মুমিনদের ঈমান বৃদ্ধি পায় এবং কিতাবীরা ও মুমিনগণ সন্দেহ পোষণ না করে এবং যাতে যাদের অন্তরে রোগ আছে, তারা এবং কাফেররা বলে যে, আল্লাহ এর দ্বারা কি বোঝাতে চেয়েছেন। এমনিভাবে আল্লাহ যাকে ইচ্ছা পথভ্রষ্ট করেন এবং যাকে ইচ্ছা সৎপথে চালান। আপনার পালনকর্তার বাহিনী সম্পর্কে একমাত্র তিনিই জানেন এটা তো মানুষের জন্যে উপদেশ বৈ নয়।
null.verse 74:33: শপথ রাত্রির যখন তার অবসান হয়,
null.verse 74:34: শপথ প্রভাতকালের যখন তা আলোকোদ্ভাসিত হয়,
null.verse 74:35: নিশ্চয় জাহান্নাম গুরুতর বিপদসমূহের অন্যতম,
null.verse 74:37: তোমাদের মধ্যে যে সামনে অগ্রসর হয় অথবা পশ্চাতে থাকে।
null.verse 74:38: প্রত্যেক ব্যক্তি তার কৃতকর্মের জন্য দায়ী;
null.verse 74:39: কিন্তু ডানদিকস্থরা,
null.verse 74:40: তারা থাকবে জান্নাতে এবং পরস্পরে জিজ্ঞাসাবাদ করবে।
null.verse 74:42: বলবেঃ তোমাদেরকে কিসে জাহান্নামে নীত করেছে?
null.verse 74:43: তারা বলবেঃ আমরা নামায পড়তাম না,
null.verse 74:45: আমরা সমালোচকদের সাথে সমালোচনা করতাম।
null.verse 74:46: এবং আমরা প্রতিফল দিবসকে অস্বীকার করতাম।
null.verse 74:47: আমাদের মৃত্যু পর্যন্ত।
null.verse 74:48: অতএব, সুপারিশকারীদের সুপারিশ তাদের কোন উপকারে আসবে না।
null.verse 74:49: তাদের কি হল যে, তারা উপদেশ থেকে মুখ ফিরিয়ে নেয়?
null.verse 74:52: বরং তাদের প্রত্যেকেই চায় তাদের প্রত্যেককে একটি উম্মুক্ত গ্রন্থ দেয়া হোক।
null.verse 74:53: কখনও না, বরং তারা পরকালকে ভয় করে না।
null.verse 74:54: কখনও না, এটা তো উপদেশ মাত্র।
null.verse 74:55: অতএব, যার ইচ্ছা, সে একে স্মরণ করুক।
null.verse 74:56: তারা স্মরণ করবে না, কিন্তু যদি আল্লাহ চান। তিনিই ভয়ের যোগ্য এবং ক্ষমার অধিকারী। করুক।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:1: О, ти, който се обвиваш [в своите одежди],
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:6: и давайки, не се стреми да получиш вповече,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:7: и в името на твоя Господ бъди търпелив!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:8: И когато се протръби с Рога,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:9: тогава този Ден ще е тежък Ден,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:11: Остави на Мен онзи, когото сътворих самотен
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:15: А после той ламти да му надбавя.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:16: Ала не! Пред Нашите знамения той упорства.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:17: Ще го подложа на непоносимо мъчение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:19: и - проклет да е! - как прецени!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:20: И отново - проклет да е! - как прецени!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:23: После се отвърна и се възгордя.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:24: И рече: Това е само разпространена магия.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:26: Ще го пека Аз в Преизподнята.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:27: И откъде да знаеш ти какво е Преизподнята?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:28: Тя нищо не оставя и не пощадява -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:31: И сторихме пазители на Огъня само ангели, и сторихме броя им единствено за изпитание на неверниците, за да се убедят дарените с Писанието и да се усили вярата на повярвалите, и да не се съмняват дарените с Писанието и вярващите, и за да кажат онези, в чии
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:32: Ала не! Кълна се в луната
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:38: за всеки от вас, който пожелае да напредва или да изостава.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:39: Всеки е заложник на онова, което е придобил,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:44: Ще рекат: Ние не бяхме сред отслужващите молитвата
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:46: и затъвахме в празнословие със затъващите,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:47: и взимахме за лъжа Съдния ден,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:49: Затова не ще им помогне ничие застъпничество.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:50: Какво им е, защо се отдръпват от напомнянето,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:53: И всеки от тях иска да му се даде разясняващата книга.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:54: Ала не! Те не се страхуват от отвъдния живот.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:55: Ала не! Той [- Коранът] е поучение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:56: И който пожелае, ще се поучи.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 74:57: И не се поучават, без Аллах да пожелае.

null.verse 74:2: 你應當起來，你應當警告，
null.verse 74:6: 你不要施恩而求厚報，
null.verse 74:7: 你應當為你的主而堅忍。
null.verse 74:9: 在那時，將有一個艱難的日子。
null.verse 74:10: 那個日子對不信道的人們，是不容易渡過的。
null.verse 74:11: 你讓我獨自處治我所創造的那個人吧！
null.verse 74:12: 我賞賜他豐富的財產，
null.verse 74:13: 和在跟前的子嗣，
null.verse 74:14: 我提高了他的聲望，
null.verse 74:15: 而他還冀望我再多加賞賜。
null.verse 74:16: 絕不然，他確實是反對我的跡象的，
null.verse 74:17: 我將使他遭受苦難。
null.verse 74:18: 他碓已思考，確已計劃。
null.verse 74:19: 但無論他怎樣計劃，他是被棄絕的。
null.verse 74:20: 無論他怎樣計劃，他終是被棄絕的。
null.verse 74:22: 然後皺眉蹙額，
null.verse 74:23: 然後高傲地轉過身去，
null.verse 74:24: 而且說：「這只是傳習的魔術，
null.verse 74:25: 這只是凡人的言辭。」
null.verse 74:26: 我將使他墮入火獄，
null.verse 74:27: 你怎能知道火獄是什麼？
null.verse 74:28: 它不讓任何物存在，不許任何物留下，
null.verse 74:31: 我只將管理火獄的成天神，我只以他們的數目，考驗不信道的人們，以便曾受天經的人們認清，而信道的人們更加篤信；以免曾受天經的人們和信道的人們懷疑；以便心中有病者和不信道者說：「真主設這個譬喻做什麼？」真主這樣使他所意欲的人誤入迷途，使他所意欲的人遵循正路。只有你的主，能知道他的軍隊，這只是人類的教訓。
null.verse 74:33: 以逝去的黑夜盟誓，
null.verse 74:34: 以顯照的黎明盟誓，
null.verse 74:35: 火獄確是一個大難，
null.verse 74:37: 警告你們中欲前進者或欲後退者；
null.verse 74:38: 各人將因自己的營謀而作抵押，
null.verse 74:39: 惟幸福的人們除外。
null.verse 74:40: 他們在樂園中互相詢問，
null.verse 74:42: 「你們為什麼墮入火獄呢？」
null.verse 74:43: 他們說：「我們沒有禮拜，
null.verse 74:45: 我們與妄言的人們一道妄言，
null.verse 74:46: 我們否認報應日，
null.verse 74:47: 一直到死亡降臨了我們。」
null.verse 74:48: 說情者的說情，將無益於他們。
null.verse 74:49: 他們怎麼退避這教訓呢？
null.verse 74:50: 他們好像一群驚慌的驢子，
null.verse 74:51: 剛逃避了一隻獅子一樣。
null.verse 74:52: 不然，他們中的每個人都希望獲得一些展開的天經。
null.verse 74:53: 絕不然，他們不畏懼後世！
null.verse 74:54: 真的，這《古蘭經》確是一個教誨！
null.verse 74:55: 誰願意，誰記憶它，
null.verse 74:56: 他們只因真主的意欲而記憶它。他是應受敬畏的，他是宜於赦宥的。 誰願意，誰記憶它，

null.verse 74:6: kvůli rozmnožování zisku neuštědřuj
null.verse 74:7: a při Pánu svém trpělivě stůj!
null.verse 74:9: ten den bude věru těžkým dnem,
null.verse 74:11: Nech Mne s tím, jehož jsem Já jediný stvořil,
null.verse 74:12: jemuž jsem majetek rozsáhlý daroval
null.verse 74:13: a syny zde přítomné uštědřil
null.verse 74:14: a jemuž jsem vše hladce uhladil,
null.verse 74:15: a on pak ještě dychtí, abych více mu dal!
null.verse 74:16: Však pozor! Vždyť proti Našim znamením on brojí,
null.verse 74:17: však vyženu ho na vrch příkrý!
null.verse 74:18: On věru vymýšlel a rozhodoval,
null.verse 74:19: ať tedy zhyne tak, jak rozhodoval!
null.verse 74:20: A znovu: ať tedy zhyne tak, jak rozhodoval!
null.verse 74:22: pak zamračil se a nasupil,
null.verse 74:23: nakonec zády se obrátil a pyšně odcházel
null.verse 74:24: a pravil: "To není leč kouzlo osvojené
null.verse 74:25: a slova jen bytosti smrtelné!"
null.verse 74:26: Sežehnu však já jej v ohni Saqaru!
null.verse 74:27: Víš ty vůbec, co je to Saqar?
null.verse 74:28: Nic nenechá a nic nepustí
null.verse 74:30: a devatenáct andělů nad ním bdí.
null.verse 74:31: A za strážce pekla jsme pouze anděly určili a jejich počet jen pro pokušení nevěřících stanovili, aby ti, jímž dostalo se Písma, se utvrdili a rozmnožila se víra těch, kdož uvěřili, a aby věřící a ti, jimž Písmo bylo dáno, nepochybovali a aby ti, v jejichž srdcích nemoc je, a také nevěřící pravili: "Co chtěl Bůh tímto příkladem říci?" Takto Bůh zbloudit nechává, koho chce, a vede cestou přímou, koho chce.
null.verse 74:33: při noci, když ustupuje,
null.verse 74:34: při úsvitu, když se rozjasňuje!
null.verse 74:35: Saqar je věru jeden z trestů největších,
null.verse 74:37: těm z vás, kdož chtějí k víře vpředu jít anebo se chtějí opozdit.
null.verse 74:38: Každá duše je ručitelkou toho, co si sama vysloužila,
null.verse 74:39: kromě lidi po pravici,
null.verse 74:40: kteří v zahradách vzájemně se budou ptát
null.verse 74:42: Co přivedlo vás do Saqaru?
null.verse 74:43: odvětí: "Nebyli jsme mezi modlitbu konajícími
null.verse 74:45: ale tlachali jsme mezi tlachajícími
null.verse 74:46: a den soudný jsme za lež prohlásili,
null.verse 74:47: až přišla na nás tato jistota!"
null.verse 74:48: A nebude jim nic platná přímluva přímluvců!
null.verse 74:49: Co s nimi je, že se odvracejí od připomenutí,
null.verse 74:52: Věru, chce každý z nich, aby svitky rozevřené mu byly přineseny?
null.verse 74:53: Však pozor! Oni se naopak neobávají života budoucího.
null.verse 74:54: Však pozor! Toto jest připomenutí,
null.verse 74:55: a kdo chce, ať na ně si vzpomene!
null.verse 74:56: Však vzpomenou si jen tehdy, když Bůh si to bude přát a Jemu náleží, aby se Ho báli, a Jemu patří odpuštění dát! vzpomene!

null.verse 74:3: En verkondig de Grootheid van uw Heer,
null.verse 74:6: Bewijs geen gunsten om u daardoor te verrijken.
null.verse 74:7: En wees geduldig ter wille van uw Heer.
null.verse 74:8: Want als de bazuin wordt geblazen,
null.verse 74:9: Die Dag zal een moeilijke dag zijn.
null.verse 74:11: Laat Mij alleen met hem die Ik schiep.
null.verse 74:12: Ik heb hem overvloedig bezit gegeven.
null.verse 74:13: En zonen die bij hem zijn.
null.verse 74:14: En ik verschafte hem elk gemak.
null.verse 74:15: Toch verlangt hij dat Ik hem nog meer zal geven.
null.verse 74:16: Stellig niet; want hij was vijandig tegenover Onze boodschappen.
null.verse 74:17: Hem zal Ik een zware straf opleggen.
null.verse 74:18: Ziet! Hij dacht na en hij besloot!
null.verse 74:19: Vervloekt zij hij, hoe besloot hij!
null.verse 74:20: Nogmaals, vervloekt zij hij! Hoe be sloot hij!
null.verse 74:22: Daarna fronste hij zijn voorhoofd en keek nors.
null.verse 74:23: Dan keerde hij zich om en toonde zich hovaardig.
null.verse 74:24: Hij zeide: "Dit is niets dan een nagebootste tovenarij.
null.verse 74:25: Dit is slechts het woord van een mens.
null.verse 74:26: Weldra zal Ik hem in het Vuur werpen.
null.verse 74:27: En wat weet gij wat het Vuur der hel is?
null.verse 74:28: Het ontziet niets, noch laat het iets (onverteerd) achter,
null.verse 74:31: En Wij hebben niets dan engelen tot wachters van het Vuur gemaakt.
null.verse 74:33: En de nacht als zij heengaat
null.verse 74:34: En de dageraad wanneer zij gloort,
null.verse 74:35: Waarlijk, het is een der grootste tijdingen
null.verse 74:37: Aan degene onder u, die vooruit wenst te gaan of degene die wil achterblijven,
null.verse 74:38: Elke ziel is als een pand voor hetgeen zij doet.
null.verse 74:39: Doch degenen aan de rechter hand
null.verse 74:40: In tuinen (wonende) vragen zij:
null.verse 74:42: "Wat heeft u in de hel gebracht?"
null.verse 74:43: Zij zullen antwoorden: "Wij behoorden niet tot hen die plachten te bidden.
null.verse 74:45: En wij plachten ijdele gesprekken te voeren met hen die ijdele gesprekken voerden.
null.verse 74:46: En wij plachten de Dag des Oordeels te loochenen.
null.verse 74:47: Totdat de dood ons overviel.
null.verse 74:48: De tussenkomst van bemiddelaars zal hen daarom niets baten.
null.verse 74:49: Wat scheelt hun dat zij zich van de vermaning afwenden
null.verse 74:52: Neen, ieder van hen wenst dat hem opengeslagen bladzijden zullen worden getoond.
null.verse 74:53: Voorwaar, zij vrezen het Hiernamaals niet!
null.verse 74:54: Neen, waarlijk, dit is een vermaning
null.verse 74:55: Die wil, trekke er lering uit.
null.verse 74:56: Doch zij zullen er geen lering uit trekken tenzij God het wil.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:1: O thou enveloped in thy cloak,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:6: And show not favour, seeking wordly gain!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:7: For the sake of thy Lord, be patient!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:8: For when the trumpet shall sound,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:9: Surely that day will be a day of anguish,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:11: Leave Me (to deal) with him whom I created lonely,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:12: And then bestowed upon him ample means,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:13: And sons abiding in his presence
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:15: Yet he desireth that I should give more.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:16: Nay! For lo! he hath been stubborn to Our revelations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:17: On him I shall impose a fearful doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:18: For lo! he did consider; then he planned -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:20: Again (self-)destroyed is he, how he planned! -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:22: Then frowned he and showed displeasure.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:23: Then turned he away in pride
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:24: And said: This is naught else than magic from of old;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:25: This is naught else than speech of mortal man.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:26: Him shall I fling unto the burning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:27: - Ah, what will convey unto thee what that burning is! -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:28: It leaveth naught; it spareth naught
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:31: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire, and their number have We made to be a stumbling-block for those who disbelieve; that those to whom the Scripture hath been given may have certainty, and that believers may increase in faith; and that those to whom the Scripture hath been given and believers may not doubt; and that those in whose hearts there is disease, and disbelievers, may say: What meaneth Allah by this similitude ? Thus Allah sendeth astray whom He will, and whom He will He guideth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:33: And the night when it withdraweth
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:34: And the dawn when it shineth forth,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:35: Lo! this is one of the greatest (portents)
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:37: Unto him of you who will advance or hang back.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:38: Every soul is a pledge for its own deeds;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:39: Save those who will stand on the right hand.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:40: In gardens they will ask one another
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:42: What hath brought you to this burning ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:43: They will answer: We were not of those who prayed
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:44: Nor did we feed the wretched.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:45: We used to wade (in vain dispute) with (all) waders,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:46: And we used to deny the Day of Judgment,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:47: Till the Inevitable came unto us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:48: The mediation of no mediators will avail them then.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:49: Why now turn they away from the Admonishment,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:52: Nay, but everyone of them desireth that he should be given open pages (from Allah).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 74:56: And they will not heed unless Allah willeth (it).

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:1: O thou wrapped up (in the mantle)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:3: And thy Lord do thou magnify!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:4: And thy garments keep free from stain!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:6: Nor expect, in giving, any increase (for thyself)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:7: But, for thy Lord’s (Cause), be patient and constant!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:8: Finally, when the Trumpet is sounded,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:9: That will be- that Day - a Day of Distress,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:10: Far from easy for those without Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:11: Leave Me alone, (to deal) with the (creature) whom I created (bare and) alone!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:12: To whom I granted resources in abundance,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:13: And sons to be by his side!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:14: To whom I made (life) smooth and comfortable!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:15: Yet is he greedy-that I should add (yet more);-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:16: By no means! For to Our Signs he has been refractory!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:17: Soon will I visit him with a mount of calamities!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:18: For he thought and he plotted;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:19: And woe to him! How he plotted!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:20: Yea, Woe to him; How he plotted!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:22: Then he frowned and he scowled;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:23: Then he turned back and was haughty;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:24: Then said he: "This is nothing but magic, derived from of old;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:25: "This is nothing but the word of a mortal!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:26: Soon will I cast him into Hell-Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:27: And what will explain to thee what Hell-Fire is?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:28: Naught doth it permit to endure, and naught doth it leave alone!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:29: Darkening and changing the colour of man!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:31: And We have set none but angels as Guardians of the Fire; and We have fixed their number only as a trial for Unbelievers,- in order that the People of the Book may arrive at certainty, and the Believers may increase in Faith,- and that no doubts may be left for the People of the Book and the Believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the Unbelievers may say, "What symbol doth God intend by this ?" Thus doth God leave to stray whom He pleaseth, and guide whom He pleaseth: and none can know the forces of thy Lord, except He and this is no other than a warning to mankind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:33: And by the Night as it retreateth,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:34: And by the Dawn as it shineth forth,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:35: This is but one of the mighty (portents),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:37: To any of you that chooses to press forward, or to follow behind;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:38: Every soul will be (held) in pledge for its deeds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:39: Except the Companions of the Right Hand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:40: (They will be) in Gardens (of Delight): they will question each other,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:43: They will say: "We were not of those who prayed;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:44: "Nor were we of those who fed the indigent;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:45: "But we used to talk vanities with vain talkers;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:46: "And we used to deny the Day of Judgment,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:47: "Until there came to us (the Hour) that is certain.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:48: Then will no intercession of (any) intercessors profit them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:49: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from admonition?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:50: As if they were affrighted asses,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:52: Forsooth, each one of them wants to be given scrolls (of revelation) spread out!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:53: By no means! But they fear not the Hereafter,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:54: Nay, this surely is an admonition:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:55: Let any who will, keep it in remembrance!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 74:56: But none will keep it in remembrance except as God wills: He is the Lord of Righteousness, and the Lord of Forgiveness.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:1: O thou shrouded in thy mantle,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:6: Give not, thinking to gain greater
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:7: and be patient unto thy Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:8: For when the Trump is sounded
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:9: that day will be a harsh day,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:11: Leave Me with him whom I created alone,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:12: and appointed for him ample wealth
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:14: and made all things smooth for him;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:15: then he is eager that I should do more.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:16: Nay! He is forward unto Our signs;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:17: and I shall constrain him to a hard ascent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:19: death seize him, how he determined!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:20: Again, death seize him, how he determined!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:23: then he retreated, and waxed proud.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:24: He said, ’This is naught but a trumped-up sorcery;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:26: I shall surely roast him in Sakar;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:27: and what will teach thee what is Sakar?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:28: It spares not, neither leaves alone
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:31: We have appointed only angels to be masters of the Fire, and their number We have appointed only as a trial for the unbelievers, that those who were given the Book may have certainty, and that those who believe may increase in belief, and that those who were given the Book and those who believe may not be in-doubt, and that those in whose hearts there is sickness, and the unbelievers, may say, ’What did God intend by this as a similitude?’ So God leads astray whomsoever He will, and He guides whomsoever He will; and none knows the hosts of thy Lord but He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:33: and the night when it retreats
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:34: and the dawn when it is white,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:35: surely it is one of the greatest things
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:37: to whoever of you desires to go forward or lag behind.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:38: Every soul shall be pledged for what it has earned,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:39: save the Companions of the Right;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:43: They shall say, ’We were not of those who prayed, and
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:45: and we plunged along with the plungers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:46: and we cried lies to the Day of Doom,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:47: till the Certain came to us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:48: Then the intercession of the intercessors shall not profit them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:49: What ails them, that they turn away from the Reminder,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:50: as if they were startled asses
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:52: Nay, every man of them desires to be -- given -- scrolls unrolled.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:53: No indeed; but they do not fear the Hereafter.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:54: No indeed; surely it is a Reminder;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:55: so whoever wills shall remember it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 74:56: And they will not remember, except that God wills; He is worthy to be feared, -- worthy to forgive.

Muhammad Asad.verse 74:6: And do not through giving seek thyself to gain,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:7: but unto thy Sustainer turn in patience.
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:8: And [warn all men that] when the trumpet-call [of resurrection] is sounded,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:9: that very Day shall be a day of anguish,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:10: not of ease, for all who
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:12: LEAVE Me alone [to deal] with him whom I have created alone,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:13: and to whom I have granted resources vast,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:16: and to whose life I gave so wide a scope:
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:17: and yet, he greedily desires that I give yet more!
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:18: Nay, verily, it is against Our messages that he knowingly, stubbornly sets himself
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:19: [and so] I shall constrain him to endure a painful uphill climb!
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:20: Behold, [when Our messages are conveyed to one who is bent on denying the truth,] he reflects and meditates [as to how to disprove them]
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:21: and thus he destroys himself, the way he meditates:
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:22: yea, he destroys himself, the way he meditates!
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:23: and then he looks [around for new arguments],
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:24: and then he frowns and glares,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:25: and in the end he turns his back [on Our message], and glories in his arrogance,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:26: and says, "All this is mere spellbinding eloquence handed down [from olden times]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:27: This is nothing but the word of mortal man!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:29: I shall cause him to endure hell-fire [in the life to come]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:30: And what could make thee conceive what hell-fire is?
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:31: It does not allow to live, and neither leaves [to die],
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:32: making [all truth] visible to mortal man.
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:34: For We have caused none but angelic powers to lord over the fire [of hell]; and We have not caused their number to be aught but a trial for those who are bent on denying the truth – to the end that they who have been granted revelation aforetime might be convinced [of the truth of this divine writ]; and that they who have attained to faith [in it] might grow yet more firm in their faith; and that
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:35: they who have been granted the earlier revelation and they who believe [in this one] might be freed of all doubt; and that they in whose hearts is disease and they who deny the truth outright might ask, "What does
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:36: God mean by this parable?" In this way God lets go astray him that wills [to go astray],and guides aright him that wills [to be guided].
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:38: Consider the night when it departs,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:39: and the morn when it dawns!
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:41: is indeed one of the great
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:43: to every one of you, whether he chooses to come forward or to hang back!
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:44: [On the Day of Judgment,] every human being will be held in pledge for whatever
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:46: save only those who shall have attained to righteousness:
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:48: in gardens [of paradise], they will inquire
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:49: of those who were lost in sin:
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:51: They will answer: "We were not among those who prayed,
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:52: and neither did we feed the needy;
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:53: and we were wont to indulge in sinning together with all [the others] who indulged in it;
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:54: and the Day of Judgment we were wont to call a lie
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:55: until certainty came upon us [in death].
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:56: And so, of no benefit to them could be the intercession of any that would intercede for them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:57: WHAT, THEN, is amiss with them that they turn away from all admonition
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:58: as though they were terrified asses
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:60: Yea, every one of them claims that he
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:61: ought to have been given revelations unfolded!
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:62: Nay, but they do not [believe in and, hence, do not] fear the life to come.
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:63: Nay, verily, this is an admonition
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:64: and whoever wills may take it to heart.
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:65: (56) But they [who do not believe in the life to come] will not take it to heart unless God so wills:
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:66: He is the Fount of all God-consciousness, and the Fount of all forgiveness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:67: commentators, the meaning [of this verse] is, ‘purify thy heart of all that is blameworthy’.
Muhammad Asad.verse 74:71: verses dealing with these allegories (hādhihi ’l-mutashābihāt)”: hence my compromise rendering “all this.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:1: O you, enveloped in a mantle,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:3: and pronounce the greatness of your Lord,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:6: and do not do a favour (to anyone merely) to seek more (in return).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:7: And for the sake of your Lord, observe patience.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:8: For when the trumpet will be blown,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:9: that day will be a difficult day,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:11: Leave me alone (to deal) with the one whom I created lonely,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:14: and extended (power and honour) to him pretty well.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:15: Still, he aspires that I should give him more.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:16: Never! He is inimical towards Our verses.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:17: I will force him to climb the mountain Sa‘ūd.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:19: Death onto him! How (bad) is the surmise he put forward!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:20: Again, death unto him! How (bad) is the surmise he put forward!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:21: Then he looked (to those around him,)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:23: then turned his back, and waxed proud,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:24: then said, “This is nothing but traditional magic;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:25: this is nothing but saying of a mortal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:26: I will put him into Saqar (Hell).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:27: And what can let you know what Saqar is?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:28: It neither spares (anything inside it from burning) nor leaves (any disbeliever outside).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:31: And We did not make wardens of the Fire but (from) angels, and did not fix their number but as a test for those who disbelieve, so that those who are given the Book may come to believe, and those who believe may improve in belief, and so that those who are given the Book and those who believe may not doubt (its correctness), and so that those having malady in their hearts and the disbelievers say, “What has Allah meant by this strange statement?” Thus Allah lets go astray whomever He wills, and leads to the right path whomever He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:32: Truly, I swear by the moon,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:33: and by the night when it goes back,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:34: and by the morning when it becomes bright,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:35: it (Saqar : Hell) is one of the greatest things
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:36: as a warning to the mankind,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:37: to the one from among you who wishes to come forward (towards good deeds) or to go back (from them).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:38: Everyone will be detained (in the Hell) because of what he did,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:39: except the People of the Right, (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:40: who will be in gardens, asking
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:43: They will say, “We were not among those who offered Salāh , (obligatory prayer)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:44: and we did not give food to the needy,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:45: and we indulged (in mocking at the truth) along with those who indulged,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:46: and we used to deny the Day of Requital,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:47: until when we were overtaken by that which is certain.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:48: Then intercession of intercessors will not benefit them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:49: So what has happened to them that they are turning away from the Reminder,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:50: as if they were wild donkeys,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:52: Rather, every one of them wishes that he should be given unrolled (divine) scriptures.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:53: Never! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:54: Never! Indeed, this is a Reminder.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:55: So, whoever so wishes may take advice from it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 74:56: And they will not take advice unless Allah so wills.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:2: Rise and give warning (to the people).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:3: And glorify the Greatnesss (and Majesty) of your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:4: And (always) keep your (visible and spiritual) attire purified and cleansed (as before).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:5: And keep away from the idols (and sins as usual).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:6: And do not do a favour (to anyone with the purpose of) seeking more from him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:7: And observe patience for the sake of your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:8: Then when the Trumpet will be blown (a second time),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:9: So that Day (the Day of Resurrection) will be an extremely hard day,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:10: Not at all easy for the disbelievers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:11: Leave Me (to take revenge) on him whom I have created alone,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:12: And I provided him wealth in abundance,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:13: And (gave) him sons remaining present (before him),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:14: And granted him affluence (in sources of luxury).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:15: Yet he desires that I should give him more.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:16: No way! He has certainly been inimical to Our Revelations.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:17: Soon I shall afflict him with (the punishment of) a severe toil.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:18: Surely, he reflected and devised a plot.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:19: So let (Allah’s) curse be on him! How he plotted!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:20: Let again (Allah’s) curse be on him! How he plotted!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:21: Then he pondered (over his scheme again).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:22: Then he frowned and twisted his face.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:23: Then he turned back (from the truth) and showed arrogance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:24: Then he said: ‘This (Qur’an) is nothing but magic which is being transmitted from the past (magicians).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:25: This (Qur’an) is nothing (else) but the words of a human being.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:26: I will soon cast him into Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:27: And who has told you what Saqar (the Fire of Hell) is?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:28: That (is the Fire which) does not spare, nor does it leave out.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:29: (That) scorches the skin and blackens it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:30: There are nineteen (angels appointed as guards) over it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:31: And We have appointed only angels as guards of Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:32: Yes! By the moon (whose increase, decrease and disappearance is evidence),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:33: And by the night when it backs away to depart,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:34: And by the morning when it brightens,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:35: Surely, this (Hell) is one of the greatest calamities.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:36: It is a warning to mankind,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:37: For any of you who seeks to advance forward (in piety) or who lags behind (trapped in evil);
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:38: Everyone is held in pledge for (the deeds) that he has earned,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:39: Except for those on the Right Side.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:40: (They) will be in Gardens and will be asking one another,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:42: (And they will say:) ‘What has brought you into Hell?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:43: They will say: ‘We were not of those who used to offer Prayers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:44: Nor did we feed the poor.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:45: And we indulged in vain activities with those who had cast themselves into vain activities.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:46: And we rejected the Day of Reward and Punishment,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:47: Until that (death), which was certain to come, came upon us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:48: So (now) the intercession of the intercessors will not be of any benefit to them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:49: Then what is the matter with these (disbelievers that even then) they turn away from the Reminder,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:50: As if they were startled (wild) donkeys,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:52: In fact, every one of them desires that he should be given (directly) open scrolls of (heavenly) scriptures.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:53: That is not possible at all.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:54: There is no doubt that this (Qur’an) is a Reminder.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:55: So whoever wills may remember it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 74:56: And they will not remember (it) unless Allah so wills.

null.verse 74:6: älä jaa antimia saadaksesi ne runsaampina takaisin,
null.verse 74:7: vaan pysy lujana Jumalan asiassa.
null.verse 74:9: on se päivä oleva ankara päivä,
null.verse 74:11: Jätä Minun huostaani hänet, jonka olen luonut,
null.verse 74:12: jolle olen antanut runsaasti rikkauksia
null.verse 74:13: ja poikia silmien iloksi,
null.verse 74:14: jonka asioita olen parhain päin sovitellut
null.verse 74:15: ja joka vain haluaa yhä enemmän.
null.verse 74:16: Mutta totisesti ei! Sillä hän uhmaa tunnusmerkkejämme;
null.verse 74:17: Minä panen hänen kestettäväkseen raskaan kurituksen.
null.verse 74:18: Kylläpä hän mietti ja mietti;
null.verse 74:19: voi, miten hän harkitsikaan!
null.verse 74:20: Ja kuinka hän punnitsi mielessään!
null.verse 74:22: sitten rypisti otsaansa ja näytti tuimalta,
null.verse 74:23: sitten hän kääntyi pois ja paisui ylpeydestä
null.verse 74:24: ja sanoi: »Tämä on pelkkää opittua noituutta,
null.verse 74:25: pelkkiä sanoja kuolevaisen suusta.
null.verse 74:26: Minä syöksen hänet helvetin liekkeihin.
null.verse 74:27: Mutta kuinka saisin sinut käsittämään, mikä tuo palo on?
null.verse 74:28: Se ei jätä jäljelle mitään eikä säästä ketään;
null.verse 74:31: Tulen vartijoiksi asetimme vain enkeleitä, ja heidän lukunsa asetimme vain koetukseksi niille, jotka eivät usko, jotta ne, joille on annettu Pyhä kirja, olisivat varmoja, ja ne, jotka uskovat, kasvaisivat uskossa; jotta Pyhän kirjan saaneet sekä uskovaiset eivät epäilisi, ja taasen ne, joiden sydämissä on sairaus ja epäusko, sanoisivat: »Mitä tarkoittaa Jumala tällä vertauksella?» Näin johtaa Jumala harhaan kenet haluaa ja ohjaa ketä mielii, eikä Herrasi sotajoukkoja tunne kukaan muu kuin Hän itse, tämä on vain muistutus kuolevaisille.
null.verse 74:33: Vakuutan kuun ja valkenevan yön nimessä
null.verse 74:34: sekä aamun nimessä, kun sen valkeus sarastaa:
null.verse 74:35: tämä on totisesti ankarampia asioista,
null.verse 74:37: jokaiselle teistä, joka tahtoo päästä eteenpäin tai jäädä jälkeen:
null.verse 74:38: jokainen sielu on vastuussa teoistaan,
null.verse 74:39: paitsi ne, jotka ovat (Jumalan) oikealla puolella.
null.verse 74:40: Ollessaan paratiisissa nämä kyselevät toisiltaan
null.verse 74:42: »Mikä on saattanut teidät tulen ruoaksi?»
null.verse 74:43: Ja nämä vastaavat: »Me emme kuuluneet niihin, jotka rukoilivat,
null.verse 74:45: vaan haastoimme joutavia niiden kanssa, jotka turhia puhuivat;
null.verse 74:46: me pidimme puhetta tuomiopäivästä valheena,
null.verse 74:47: kunnes kuolema yllätti meidät.
null.verse 74:48: Niinpä ei heitä enää hyödytä puolustajain apu.
null.verse 74:49: Mutta miksi he kääntyvät pois muistuttajasta
null.verse 74:52: Jokainen heistä odottaa erikoiskutsua.
null.verse 74:53: Mutta eiväthän he pelkää tulevaa elämää.
null.verse 74:54: Ei! Tämä on totisesti varoitus,
null.verse 74:55: ja kukin halukas voi painaa sen mieleensä.
null.verse 74:56: Mutta he eivät tahdo pitää sitä mielessään, ellei se ole Jumalan tahto.

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:1: O toi qui es couvert d'un manteau !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:6: Ne donne pas pour obtenir davantage.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:9: ce Jour sera un Jour pénible,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:10: un Jour peu facile pour les mécréants.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:11: Laisse-Moi seul avec celui que J'ai créé à Moi seul,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:12: que j'ai pourvu d'une vaste fortune
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:16: Rien de cela !, car il s'est obstiné à nier Nos signes ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:17: bientôt, Je lui ferai gravir une montagne de calamités.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:18: Il a bien réfléchi et il a décidé.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:19: Qu'il périsse donc comme il a décidé !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:20: De vrai, comme il a décidé !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:22: puis il a froncé le sourcil et s'est renfrogné ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:23: puis il a tourné le dos et s'est enflé d'orgueil.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:24: Il a dit : " Ce n'est que magie apprise des Anciens !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:25: Ce n'est que la parole d'un mortel ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:26: Je vais le jeter dans le Feu ardent (Saqar)
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:27: Mais qui te fera connaître ce qu'est Saqar ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:28: Il ne laisse rien subsister et il ne lâche pas prise ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:29: il brûle la peau des mortels et la noircit.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:31: Nous n'avons pris comme gardiens du Feu que des anges, et Nous n'avons choisi ce nombre que pour éprouver ceux qui mécroient, et afin que ceux qui ont reçu le Livre acquièrent la certitude ; pour qu'augmente la foi des croyants ; pour que ceux qui ont reçu le Livre et les croyants ne doutent plus ; pour que ceux dont les cœurs sont atteints d'un mal disent, avec les mécréants : " Que Dieu veut-il signifier par cette parabole ? " C'est ainsi que Dieu égare qui Il veut et qu'Il dirige qui Il veut.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:33: et par la nuit quand elle se retire,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:34: et par l'aurore quand elle jaunit !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:35: Il s'agit là d'une chose gravissime,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:37: pour ceux d'entre vous qui veulent avancer ou rester en arrière.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:38: Toute âme se porte caution pour ce qu'elle a accompli,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:39: à l'exception des compagnons de la droite.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:40: Ceux-ci, dans les Jardins, s'interrogent entre eux
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:42: " Qu'est-ce qui vous a conduits dans Saqar ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:43: Ils répondront : " Nous n'étions pas au nombre de ceux qui prient ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:44: nous ne nourrissions pas le pauvre ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:45: nous discutions vainement avec des beaux parleurs ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:46: nous traitions de mensonge le Jour du Jugement
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:47: jusqu'à ce que nous vienne la certitude ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:48: La médiation des intercesseurs ne leur servira de rien.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:49: Qu'ont-ils donc à se détourner du Rappel,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:52: Chacun d'eux voudrait qu'on lui apporte des feuillets déployés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 74:56: Mais ils ne s'en souviendront que si Dieu le veut, Lui qui seul est digne d'être craint et capable d'accorder le pardon ! souviendra.

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:1: ô, toi (Muhammad) ! Le revêtu d’un manteau !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:3: Et de ton Seigneur, célèbre la grandeur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:6: Et ne donne pas dans le but de recevoir davantage.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:9: alors, ce jour-là sera un jour difficile,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:11: Laisse-Moi avec celui que J’ai créé seul,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:12: et à qui J’ai donné des biens étendus,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:13: et des enfants qui lui tiennent toujours compagnie,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:14: pour qui aussi J’ai aplani toutes difficultés.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:15: Cependant, il convoite [de Moi] que Je lui donne davantage.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:16: Pas du tout ! Car il reniait nos versets (le Coran) avec entêtement.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:17: Je vais le contraindre à gravir une pente.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:19: Qu’il périsse ! Comme il a décidé !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:20: Encore une fois, qu’il périsse; comme il a décidé !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:22: Et il s’est renfrogné et a durci son visage.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:23: Ensuite il a tourné le dos et s’est enflé d’orgueil.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:24: Puis il a dit : «Ceci (le Coran) n’est que magie apprise
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:25: ce n’est là que la parole d’un humain».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:26: Je vais le brûler dans le Feu intense (Saqar).
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:27: Et qui te dira ce qu’est Saqar ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:28: Il ne laisse rien et n’épargne rien;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:29: Il brûle la peau et la noircit.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:30: Ils sont dix neuf à y veiller.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:31: Nous n’avons assigné comme gardiens du Feu que les Anges.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:33: Et par la nuit quand elle se retire !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:34: Et par l’aurore quand elle se découvre !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:38: Pour qui d’entre vous, veut avancer ou reculer.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:39: Toute âme est l’otage de ce qu’elle a acquis.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:40: Sauf les gens de la droite (les élus) :
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:43: «Qu’est-ce qui vous a acheminés à Saqar ? »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:44: Ils diront : «Nous n’étions pas de ceux qui faisaient la Salat,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:45: et nous ne nourrissions pas le pauvre,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:46: et nous nous associions à ceux qui tenaient des conversations futiles,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:47: et nous traitions de mensonge le jour de la Rétribution,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:48: jusqu’à ce que nous vînt la vérité évidente [la mort]».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:49: Ne leur profitera point donc, l’intercession des intercesseurs.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:50: Qu’ont-ils à se détourner du Rappel ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:51: Ils sont comme des onagres épouvantés,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:53: Chacun d’eux voudrait plutôt qu’on lui apporte des feuilles tout étalées.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:54: Ah ! Non ! C’est plutôt qu’ils ne craignent pas l’au-delà.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:55: Ah ! Non ! Ceci est vraiment un Rappel.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:56: Quiconque veut, qu’il se le rappelle.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 74:57: Mais ils ne se rappelleront que si Dieu veut.

null.verse 74:1: O du in den Mantel Gehüllter!
null.verse 74:6: Und erweise nicht Huld, indem du Mehrung suchst.
null.verse 74:7: Und dulde standhaft um deines Herrn willen;
null.verse 74:8: Denn, wenn in die Posaune gestoßen wird,
null.verse 74:9: Der Tag wird ein schwerer Tag sein,
null.verse 74:10: Für die Ungläubigen alles eher als leicht.
null.verse 74:11: Laß Mich allein mit dem, den Ich geschaffen,
null.verse 74:12: Und dem Ich Besitz in Fülle verlieh,
null.verse 74:13: Und Söhne, die immer da waren,
null.verse 74:14: Und für den Ich alle Bequemlichkeit bereitete.
null.verse 74:15: Dennoch wünscht er, daß Ich noch mehr gebe.
null.verse 74:16: Mit nichten! denn er ist feindselig gewesen gegen Unsere Zeichen.
null.verse 74:17: Aufbürden will Ich ihm bald schreckliche Mühsal.
null.verse 74:18: Siehe, er sann und er wog!
null.verse 74:19: Verderben über ihn! Wie wog er!
null.verse 74:20: Verderben über ihn abermals! Wie wog er!
null.verse 74:22: Dann runzelte er die Stirn und blickte verdrießlich,
null.verse 74:23: Dann wandte er sich ab und war hoffärtig
null.verse 74:24: Und sprach: «Das ist nichts als Zauberei, die weitergetragen wird;
null.verse 74:25: Das ist nur Menschenwort.
null.verse 74:26: Bald werde Ich ihn ins Feuer der Hölle werfen.
null.verse 74:27: Und wie kannst du wissen, was Höllenfeuer ist?
null.verse 74:28: Es verschont nichts und läßt nichts übrig;
null.verse 74:31: Und Wir haben einzig und allein Engel zu Hütern des Feuers gemacht.
null.verse 74:33: Und bei der Nacht, wenn sie sich entfernt,
null.verse 74:34: Und bei der Morgendämmerung, wenn sie scheint,
null.verse 74:35: Wahrlich, es ist eine der größten (Heimsuchungen) -
null.verse 74:37: Für den unter euch, der vorwärts schreiten oder zurückbleiben will.
null.verse 74:38: Jede Seele ist ein Pfand für das, was sie verdient hat;
null.verse 74:39: Ausgenommen die zur Rechten,
null.verse 74:40: In Gärten einander befragend
null.verse 74:42: «Was hat euch in das Feuer der Hölle gebracht?»
null.verse 74:43: Sie werden sprechen: «Wir waren nicht unter denen, die beteten,
null.verse 74:45: Und wir ergingen uns in eitlem Geschwätz mit den Schwätzern.
null.verse 74:46: Und wir pflegten den Tag des Gerichtes zu leugnen,
null.verse 74:47: Bis der Tod uns ereilte.
null.verse 74:48: Drum wird ihnen die Fürsprache der Fürsprecher nicht nützen.
null.verse 74:49: Was ist ihnen denn, daß sie sich von der Ermahnung abwenden,
null.verse 74:52: Nein, jedermann von ihnen wünscht, es möchten ihm offene Tafeln der Offenbarung gegeben werden.
null.verse 74:53: Keineswegs! wahrlich, sie fürchten nicht das Jenseits.
null.verse 74:54: Keineswegs! wahrlich, dies ist eine Ermahnung.
null.verse 74:55: So möge, wer da will, ihrer gedenken.
null.verse 74:56: Und sie werden sich nicht ermahnen lassen, bis Allah so will.
